channel.title: Sam J A Mead
channel.description: A blog about startups, coding, the environment, and sports.

item.title: On Geniuses And Lovers
item.description:
“It is very painful, I think, to be told: ‘You enchanted the world for me, you made me feel things I never knew I could, now please be normal at dinner.’ We are always saying this to people in one way or another, of course; maybe we have to.”

Read Annie Frankly’s post on Medium

item.title: Revolt Against The Desk
item.description:
Many writers maintain a private writing hut. The hut has one purpose: it’s the place they go to write. They don’t do anything else there. Once they can’t write any more, they go do something else.

Let’s treat our desks the same way.

Read Justin Jackson’s post on Medium

Photo: Ralph Morse

Bonus! Here’s something else awesome from Justin Jackson: Words

item.title: The Lean Convert, or, Taking Lean to its Logical Conclusion
item.description:
For a long time I went around telling people how I didn’t really believe in lean. I was pretty proud of that.

Turns out, I just didn’t understand it.

You don’t either, and that’s the problem.

Being lean isn’t the same as bootstrapping.

Being lean doesn’t mean you build a prototype and throw it out there.

Being lean doesn’t mean you continually iterate your features until you find product market fit.

Ashley Aitken helped me understand!

Leaving my startup helped me understand.

Running a program helped me understand.

item.title: Emotional Detachment
item.description:
Become emotionally detached from your great idea. Start empathising instead with your customer.

Your startup is not your product, your startup is your business model.

Your business model must be repeatable, scalable, revenue generating!

To generate revenue you must have customers…

item.title: Saturday Night
item.description:
There will come a time where the photos we take today will be black and white to those who inhabit the internet.

This is here as a record of our time so that we might some way relate ourselves to those who’ll come to replace us.
